review: I had for soooo long been excited to go eat at a TGI Friday for the very first time...let's just say I haven't been back since. It was blah, the food was blah, the service was blah, the atmosphere was blah. Not going back.
The service was terrible that day.  The servers disappear or all hang out together at the front desk.  We won't be going back too soon.
Waiter was cool, food was Meh, place is kind of dirty. Sticky table + crumbs on booth = me looking around for roaches on black walls (glad i didn't find any) I will not be back to this location.

I know, I know.  It's a review for "Friday's."   I've been to probably every TGI Friday's in my area over the years.  It's just one of those last resort places I end up at. I'm only taking the time out to write this review because this particular Friday's is just awful.  Most of them are pretty consistent and okay.  For some reason, the Wood Ridge Friday's is just totally different from the rest. First of all, the food is never consistent.  It usually does not come with the correct condiments or is prepared how the menu describes and most of the time it has to be sent back.  This is the only Friday's that serves nachos differently from the other Friday's.  They are a piled up mess of fake cheese.  Every single time I have been here the food was either over cooked or undercooked or just plain disgusting.  Yes, I know it's Friday's but I've had enjoyable junk food at pretty much all of the other ones in North Jersey.   The servers/bartenders, however, are usually very nice, although not very quick.  I can judge because I was a server/bartender for years.  I waited for the bartender's attention to order food for about 25 minutes.  The only reason that I didn't leave was because I was hungover and too lazy to get up.   I don't know why I keep coming back here.  I just have to step on the brakes a little earlier and go to Houlihan's!

Worst service ever. No one wanted to help a party of 6 - didn't help out with football games on TV. Didn't offer kids menu or crayons - staff was just completely horrible and would never go to this location. If TGI Fridays didn't have their half off appetizer special, I would never go here again but I guess I will have to make it out to a different one if I am in the mood. Probably didn't want to help out since Neb and I are colored....

I've eaten here a few times and I've always had a good experience. Nothing like coming in with friends and family, and leaving full and satisfied. Service is decent, sometimes there's a wait... but that's to be expected, they get busy some nights. Overall, it's a pretty clean place with a big parking lot. The only advice I would give them is this... have the maintenance guy go around. Some chairs wobble way too much, some lights flicker or are burnt out, and some table tops feel loose. But keep up the good work.

As Fridays goes...this is one of the better ones. Like the pool table and the bartenders are alright. Does get crowed. Other poster was right on a very specific point...send a maintenance guy around to tighten up the chairs...all most of of them need some work. Watch out for amateur drinkers here as sometime they don't handle themselves well. As with all Fridays, look for the specials or coupons to get the best value. Avoid the Nachos...Nothing more than tortilla chips with a spattering of meat and a few shreds of cheese. Instead try the Pretzel sticks w/ cheese sauce or the Jack Daniels Sesame Chicken Strips. I also have a problem with another one of the reviewers. "They didn't want to serve you because you were colored?" c'mon bro...it;s 2013...That place is filled with white, black and everything else. I've personally gone their with black friends myself and it was just as cool as everywhere else around here. That's a pretty big accusation to make on a hunch.

Went for lunch. After a long wait the manager came over stated Victor would be our server and he would help us shortly. He then took our drink order.  When the manager brought our drinks He also brought out an order of nachos and then took our food order. The food was actually delivered by Victor our server. The food was ok and having a gift card meant it cost me nothing to eat that day. Considering the place was mostly empty I think they need to get some servers to actually wait tables.   On a previous visit to this location the service was even slower and they delivered the pretzel appetizer raw!.   With several other complaints about the food that day the manager comped the entire meal.

First I'd like to say that I understand if a restaurant is busy some days, but the service I got was ridiculous. No utensils sitting down, after receiving my food, I had to ask for utensils to then receive it 20 minutes later. when I finally got my food, as hungry as I am, I could barely bring myself to eat it. Things were missing from my plate, which I had to wait an extra 15 minutes to get. I ordered a plate of fries, and I found pieces of other food mixed in the fries. Disgusting. I will never return to this place again and you shouldn't either

I go here on occasion. The food, service, and drinks are good. Yes, I did read recently that the chain (as a whole) was on the watch list for Operation Swill, but I didn't find anything wrong with the drinks I've had in general, and I usually favor beer anyways. I love their Korean Steak Tacos, which have a little kick to them. Friendly service, fun laidback atmosphere. No-brainer for a casual night out.

I hope people read this review before wasting their money at this horrific restaurant. I was out with my family on a Sunday afternoon so we decided to go eat at this TGIF in Wood-Ridge NJ Route 17. For the most part the service was decent but the portion on this specific dish was very short. We ordered Chicken Jack Daniel's Strips and we literally received about 5 pieces so I asked the waiter if that was the normal portion? She replied buy saying that all dishes are measured sometimes they overflow and sometimes they don't. So she contradicted herself in one sentence. She took the order back and brought out a new one with what seem to be a normal portion of about 10-12 pieces. I didn't think much of it and we actually enjoyed the rest of the stay until I ordered my second beer. After taking a couple of sips of my cup my wife asks me if I had kissed someone with lipstick on because she didn't remember putting any on. I asked her why and she pointed at the cup that I was drinking from and it clearly had someone's lipstick stain on the rim of the glass. You can't imagine how disgusted I felt. I immediately asked to see the manager and showed him the cup and he apologized and stated that I would not have to pay for the beer. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?????? The beer???? I took 2 sips from the beer how the hell was I going to pay for that???? Who's going to pay for my medical bill if I happen to get sick or even worst get herpes or something???? I paid for my check and It's safe to say that I will never return to this TGIF in my life!!!!
This Fridays is very friendly. The servers were nice even though the weather was bad. The food was just delicious.

Don't know what happened.  TGI Fridays used to be a solid fall back place and wow did it ever disappoint.  Our server was not very nice and seemed very distracted by her phone most of the night and the food was probably the worst I've ever had at a chain restaurant.  My fiance ordered the Korean Steak Tacos, which should have just been called salad tacos because they put field greens on them with two maybe three tiny pieces of meat.  Not to mention the corn tortillas they were served on were very stale and there was really no sauce.  I however ordered the All American Burger, and if had absolutely zero flavor to it at all.  They did not season it at all and the cheese was so overly cooked it had broken and was clumping off of the burger.  By the time we had finally received our food we just ate it rather than wait the 40 minutes again to get more food.  All in all I'd rather go to the Houlihans next door from now on and I've scratched this place off my list.

My wife and I seen a commercial for Fridays and it really put us in the mood so we head over and was greeted by a couple having sex in the back seat of their car directly in front if the restaurant. No big deal.... We head inside and there was no one to seat is for several minutes. We finally was seated in a nice booth by our selves and it was pretty peaceful. We were greeted by a very nice server who was polite and checked on us throughout the entire meal. Her service after being seated was 5 stars all day.  I ordered steak and shrimp n my wife ordered steak and lobster. My steak was suppose to be Jack Daniels however I got a dry hockey puck. The shrimp and mash potatoes were good though. My wife's steak was good but her lobster pieces were way over cooked. We did not send the food back as it was 11pm and we were starving! I just remember Fridays as a very solid place to go get great food with out breaking the bank. I hate to say it but i equate the food to what you get at the drive thru. We should of went to apple bees......
always a good time at fridays only time i didnt have fun was after the nacho appetizer it made me hurl i think it was just a bit to greasy anyways everything else mixed drinks etc was great!

I want in there today for beer I sat at the bar for 15 minutes and was not approached by the bartender. The bartender stayed at the other end of the bar making drinks for the other restaurant people. I finally left. It was a terrible experience.

Came here with my cousin.  Night....fail.  For the 2 of us, we should have only been there for like 40 minutes.  We were there for over 2 hours due to the INCREDIBLY slow service.  Nobody took our order for the first 15mins and when the server finally came over, he tried to play it off like he was doing another server a favor lol It was clearly his section.  Not a big deal, but it didn't end there.  (For the record, I was a waitress for many years)  We didn't get refills on our drinks for another 30 minutes cause he was no where to be found.  Once we were done with our dinner, and my cousin wanted to order desert, again...no where to be found.  It was about 20 minutes after we were done eating that he came by, and we asked for the desert and the check.  When he brought them to us, I looked and saw he messed up the check, overcharged us by about $15.  He tried pretending it was a managment thing he forgot to get done, but that's not true.  Friday's 2 for $$ is it's own buttons on their systems.  When he finally came back over with the correct bill I made him stay put so I could look at it real quick and hand him our cards.  (I let him know in the beginning that we would be just splitting the check down the middle, 2 cards)  I reminded him to just split it down the middle.  He came back over with the receipts to sign...he'd put 40% on one, and 60% on the other.  Really????? We didn't bother calling him back over, just did the math ourselves to square up and tip.  Feel bad for the kid, saw him messing up many other orders when he was actually around.  Clearly, he's just not good at this kind of job.   As for the food, mediocore at best.  It looked yummy, but most of it was microwable quality.  Don't get me wrong, I eat microwavables lol Just...don't want it to taste like that at a restaurant.  The mozzarella sticks were bleh.  I had one bite of the desert, but it was too frozen for a real take on quality.  My fav part was probably the mac n cheese that came with my Parmesian Crusted Chicken.  But what do you expect, it's Fridays.  One thing they have going for them is their setting.  Very lounge like and comfortable.

This TGI Friday's used to be my go to spot to watch NFL games on Sundays. It was never too packed, they have a bunch of TVs and happy hour specials all day long.  I've been visiting here for a few years now and I've seen a lot of turnover but the service here has really gone downhill. On one visit, a manager was helping out at the bar (which was about 1/2 full) and neither he nor the bartender came to bring us new drinks for over 10 minutes. Part of our food order was never brought out even after we asked about it twice.  The draft beers are always a little warm compared to other restaurant bars. The potato skins are disgusting (it's like a half inch square of american cheese is microwaved on it). The mozzarella sticks are hollow and rarely warm. You'll never have your wings the same way twice. One time you'll have six wings, another time a dozen. One time they'll be doused in sauce, the other time you'll be wondering if they thought you ordered naked wings.  The happy hour prices have all gone up by a buck. Not too big a deal but coupled with the fact that the service quality has dropped and I'm more than happy to go to Houlihans next door or to another place. There are a few people here who are still really cool but it looks like they're onto bigger and better places and good for them, they should leave here.  TIP: On a crowded night, ALWAYS sit at the bar. The tables around the bar get even worse service unless you're a group of young flirty girls, then sit at a booth and smile.

Mediocracy at its best.  I stopped in on a Saturday night around 8.  The restaurant was packed, and there were people waiting at the door for tables.  Since I was by myself and just wanted to grab a quick bite, I sat at the bar.   There were two bartenders working behind the bar but I only interacted with the female bartender.   She took my drink and food order.  I asked for a glass of Kendall-Jackson Chardonnay.  Uhm, apparently TGIFridays now operates like McDonalds and there are sizes to their wine?  Anyway, I didn't realize their glasses of wine came in sizes and so I just ordered "a glass".  The surprise came at the end when I got the bill.  The bartender never asked what size glass of wine I wanted and assumed I wanted the more expensive 9 oz at $10.50.  I get that you're trying to fatten up the bill so that you can get a higher tip but it's not cool when you take the liberty to do so without asking your customer.  The wine tasted funky anyway, like the bottle had been open for a while.   I ordered the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta and asked for shrimp only, no chicken.  When my food came out, it was half shrimp, half chicken.  I guess the bartenders here just do things differently and not ask questions or get customers' orders right?  Anyway, the dish tasted just ok, it didn't have that Cajun kick and not how I had remembered it tasting.   She never once came and asked how everything was, so I couldn't let her know that the wine tasted old and that she messed up my food order.  However, she was prompt to come over to grab my credit card when I put it out to pay my bill.   Having been a server/bartender myself, I always feel compelled to over tip but even giving $3 on my bill felt unjustified.  I get that they earn their money on tips but it's not a hand out.  You actually have to do the serving.   I'm not sure how TGIFridays are training their staff or what server manual they're using but they need to get their act together.  It's the simple things.  I will definitely not go back here.

I went here on a Saturday night with my wife. After waiting for nearly 45 minutes, we finally got a table. We were really hungry and knew what we had to order. The waitress did not seem at all interested in serving us but took our orders eventually. The waitress informed me that I would need to pay extra to customize my pasta. I had never got that from any of the other TGIFs because I was just replacing a sauce but I obliged anyways. After waiting for another 40 mins, we finally got our food. It was pretty obvious that the food had been prepared long before and was just sitting at the kitchen counter inside. We ordered the Flatbread which was cold. The fries seemed stale and the pasta had dried out. We took a bite and realized we cannot eat this rubbish. We asked for the check immediately and instead of showing concern over the food that was completely left uneaten, the waitress promptly got our check. Never uttered a word.  Rest assured, I am never coming back to this place.

Just went for dinner tonite around 5 and the place wasn't really busy. My husband and I sat at tables by the bar and waited around 10mins for the waitress to come over and take what we thought would be our drink order cuz thats usually how it goes but NO she asked if we were ready to order. So I said yes our drink order! DUH She evenatully brought them to us and ordered our meals. My husband had the steak on a bed of spinach but let me tell you the steak was the size of small tomato, the spinach was a very small portion also. I had the burschetta chicken pasta. It was ok. There was like a 1/2 lb of pasta and very little chicken. TGI Fridays always used to be good but I don't know what happened to it. We have been there 3 xs but  never again. Service is very poor. The staff is clueless about everything. I hate to be mean about rating places but this place is the pits. Stay away! We will be going back to our favorite place Applebees in Garfield. If you go ask for Scott. Hes the best waiter EVER!

Complete waste of time coming here. Our waitress was new and messed everything up. The "manager" or whoever he was was a jerk and didn't want to help us when the waitress messed up our bills AND to top it all off, we left and saw two employees in the back getting high in their car. Never coming back :)

Just not the same the last few months without Stacy and the real crew - who moved on to greener pastures.  Not a bad spot for a quick drink after work but you have issues if you are coming here for full price anything as they go out of their way to provide discounts as long as you don't go when it is busy. Why you would go to Fridays when it's busy I won't ask again (u got issues, I get it )  Wanna pay full price for this stuff go to a real restaurant   Pay 5 a head more and enjoy.   Seacrest Out
Had an absolutely fantastic meal with great service! Our waiter was Frank, and he was so friendly. We had a great time and can't wait to go back!! Best wings.

My friends and I ordered 3 entrees to-go but didn't check the contents upon departing, only to get home and find out that they did not provide any Jack Daniel's sauce for our meal - essentially we ate dry grilled chicken and fried shrimp. Delicious. To sprinkle salt on an open wound, one of the entrees was missing a side of Mac and Cheese. Excellent. I guess it really is difficult to staff competent employees these days.
Good food. Great service and Cheap drinks during the game! Over all Can't complain. I liked this tgi Fridays because of the fast service with out groups Food and drinks.

Worst experience I've ever had at a Friday's. I will not be returning! Firstly, the waitress screwed up my order and when she did make an effort to fix it I couldn't even get what I actually wanted. There are no free refills at this location for whatever reason I do not know. Waitress made no effort to improve my dining experience oh and my food was over cooked. This restaurant sucks, the Hackensack location is way better.

I think this tgif I'd still cheating the public with drinks. Very little alcohol on their drinks. Charging you full price for it. Better off ordering beer. A regular martini should be clear not cloudy. They blame the olives. Though the food is good, getting it right is an issue. Stay away!
Went to play pool and apps with some friends and loved it. The waitress Stacey served us very professional and polite.  The food is reasonable for the price.

Food was good the waitress was so slow it was like she didn't even want to be there I ask her about lunch instead of her saying the lunch menu in the back she goes just keep looking at the menu I come back mind you there was no body else in there beside me and my kids then I had to wait 20 minutes for the check I told the host to tell her she still was taking her sweet time and then I got aggy and went and looked for her she was standing w her manager and I asked if he could get his waitress to get me the check I literally asked 4 times thank God he was kind enough to get it for me cause I was close to losing my patience IF I was to return I would NOT want that waitress she SUCKS
TGIF has changed . Not how I remembered it . Service has changed and so has the food . Food has changed price wise also . It went up  and not worth the price !

It was great not sure why this has a bad review. It was the first time I ever saw a  pool table. Happy hour was great and the food tasted fresh. I will definitely come to this TGIF in particular to do happy hour.

Me and my fiance got sick right after eating there...beware of the crab cakes...she had a decent steak.  And when we called to inform the management, they hung up the phone on us.  I would avoid this restaurants food if i were you.

I had the ribs and lobster tail. Not worth the price. The lobster was barely warm and the coleslaw tasted like it had been sitting on the counter for a day: The waitress explained that they dress the plate and then keep it warm until service. Management kindly apologized.

Came here with a few friends for dinner and it was good. I had a Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta an it's delicious. I get that everytime I go. It's spicy but creamy. It's not like super spicy, sometimes they make it super spicy but not this time, the right amount of spice. I always ask for extra sauce so it's creamy and not dry like from sitting under the heating lamps.  Usually my fiancé gets the JD burger but he was tired of burgers that day but he got a steak. It looked pretty okay. Not anything too fancy or worth remembering.  My friend got the shrimp and avocado salad and she said it was awful. The avocado was not ripe yet and was hard and she barely ate her meal.  Other thank my friends meal bring horrible, it was a good time. They even changed the tv for us twice! Our server was pretty okay. He didn't know one of the drinks that they serve so it was a little repetitive but he got it in the end.
Tables were dirty. Bar was not cleaned off. Staffs were slow. Would NOT trust the food here.

Worst bar service ever,I have been a few times,unfortunately I love the pot stickers . Their is lady,who is friendly,but tends to forget people,while she is on her cell phone or having a good times with people of her culture.It sad to say,there has been times that ,she forgets to put in a order,or the kitchen just closed...over billing for beer on the tab..I don't drink ...or  I can't order endless apps because kitchen is closing in 20 mins,then I come the same time the next night and they serve me.No reasoning.The bar really needs a better bartenders.

Went there around 3:30pm today (Saturday). Mostly empty restaurant, we are seated in the front. After a good 10 minutes go by I get up and walk to the host and ask him to please find our server.  Within minutes server arrives very apologetic for the long delay, takes our appetizer and drink orders, we explain that 2 more people are coming. This time we wait for almost 15 minutes, no drinks, no server, empty dining area except for the 2 of us. I get up again and ask the host to please get our server and explain that he took our drink order and hasn't returned. **frustrated** After a few minutes said server comes with our drinks and our appetizers and gives us a story of being under staffed blah blah blah. By this point my husband and 4yr old daughter have driven from our house to Friday's and sat down. YES, it took that long to get our drinks!! I ordered the drinks before he left my house! Spinach dip looks disgusting, like it had been frozen and heated up in a microwave, it wasn't even hot, it was warm and looked very unappetizing. Not saying anything, not worth waiting forever for something different. Besides who are we going to ask, the host? My husband orders a beer. AGAIN, very long wait, he gets up to go ask the host (only employee that we can see) for his beer. The bartender happened to round the corner with the beer just as he got up. No server. The server finally brings my sister's meal. He then picks up our unfinished appetizers, not even asking if we are finished with it, (we weren't), and goes to walk away!! We immediately ask for the check and pay right then, (not wanting to sit around for God knows how long for him to come back), We left within 5min. Not coming back.

DAN IS THE MAN!!! Holla at him if you ever come here! My coworkers & i eat here all the time & he is always a joy & entertaining to have as our waiter. He's always great on time management & making sure everything is right.

One of the best places to eat, food its amazing and service its very good that's why I go very often ladies night out with all my coworkers this girls are very crazy but that's the place to be with them.always good for a few drinks and the delicious appetizers highly recommended.

Horrible food was disgusting and everything was stale too salty. We were six people and none of barely finish 20 percent of the food. The food was the worse I've ever had in my life. I usually don't like to put a bad review but for this one I had to take time and put it because even 30 minutes later I still feel sick in my stomach. Should have seen the reviews before coming here. Common guys you are a big franchise hire some people who know how to cook food not just do slap dash job.  The potato skins tasted like the oil was not changed since a long time. The vegetables were stale and reheated and chicken was over cooked and hard. Overall everything was very low quality and bad tasting.

On Sunday, went to celebrate my wife's birthday with the entire family.  We were seated at dirty tables, had to request for them to be cleaned.  Errors were made all night with simple drink orders like water and lemon.  The bar must have been drinking themselves, ordered a specialty drink and received a piña colada.  Some of the food was served cold, had to wait nearly 30 minutes for a side of broccoli that should have came together with the entree.  We also ordered a take home order for a relative and had to wait 30 minutes after we were done because they forgot to place the order.  The restaurant was not even at half capacity. When I spoke to the manager Terence I believe was his name,  it was brushed off by giving me a couple of free apps cards. I spent $200 for bad service and that's what I get?  I'm done with TGIF. Glad that many new restaurants are opening in my area. I won't go back and encourage others not to waste your time and money either!!!

My family and I have been here many times, being that it's one of our local restaurants. A few years ago we had an issue with my lobster tail being perished, just the thought still makes me sick. I did not review because I thought well hey one bad day out of many couldn't be that bad. But now this is our 4th bad expirence, It was fairly early close to opening hours thinking our food couldn't be that bad. But no, the food was all the same just cold! I mean like out of the fridge cold. Very upsetting. I didn't say anything once again just ate what we could and just paid. After thinking about reviewing or not I decided to bc this is the only way things can get better.  Worst $90 spent for our Sunday, now I can say NEVER again!

I went for after work drinks with a coworker (later evening on a Friday).  We sat at the bar so we could people watch and unwind after a few stressful weeks at work.  Carmen is an absolute godsend!  She made us laugh, and really set the stage that allows her guests to have fun.  Music from the DJ was a little loud for conversation, but Carmen truly made up for it.   I think we found our new after work spot for drinks and unwinding.  I appreciate Carmen letting us know what her schedule is, because she made the night..  oh, and her Long Island Ice Teas are amaze balls!
Horrible food , things that were listed as a part of the food ordered didn't come . Waiter was okay, soup proportions were extremely small in comparison. Never going back .

Literally the worst Fridays ever. Called three times to make to go order and no answer. Went in and placed order at bar for sesame jack chicken strips. Have now been standing at said bar for 26 minutes with no bartender in sight for at least 15 minutes. Food just came out and there's no to go silverware and about 6 nuggets in there. Will not return. Ever.

2/12/17 sucked a bag of d#%ks doesn't say how bad this was !!! No draft beers no ingredients for mixed drinks wrong food orders brought out no management what so ever ! A dying establishment which should have been euthanized years ago !!! Plus they took my food points twice !!! Who hires these people ????

They serve old food. You can tell they do a horrible job when it's the only restaurant that never has a wait on a Saturday night or Valentine's Day. First we had chips with guacamole which looked like it sat out all day, then my chicken stripes were tiny little weird ball shape things that were barely enough and cost $12, then we got our chicken sandwich and the chicken was VERY OLD disgusting color to it once I cut it in half I wanted to vomit in there!! And on top of all that they charged us and messed up the order so we did a lot of waiting for nothing... please don't go there, even if it's the only restaurante with a lot of space available is because many people had the same issue and never went back!

Love love love Fridays for late night drinks and desserts. We don't usually crave Fridays when we want to eat good because unfortunately Fridays always taste reheated and recooked, but can never go wrong for apps and desserts! This particular week night it was quiet and empty, however our bartender was also our waitress and she was extremely pleasant for having so much to handle on her own.

This was the second or third time I had ever visited this location. Every other time was pretty good no complaints.   this time i sat at the bar And the service was horrible. It was slow and still took long for us to order our first round of drinks. Our food and then our second round which took her 10mins because she forgot about them. Now coming from a bartender for 4 years I usually give people breaks because I know how it is. Just this bartender at this location named Carmen was just bad. I dont know if she's a new bartender or was not trained correctly but TGI Fridays should take more time in training there employees.  Also there didn't seem to be a manager in site to make sure things where going correctly.  I will be coming back just because every other experience was great.

Where do I begin this review...... First of all, when we drove up to the restaurant, the parking lot was virtually empty. I think the only cars that were parked there were the cars of the employees. We were seated by the bar, and the first words out of Bobby's mouth were, what the f is that smell? I think I am going to puke. The waiter came up to us and proceeded to to say, "hi folks, what can I get for you?".  I then answered, "you can get us a seat elsewhere because it smells over here.". He says, "oh really, I can't smell anything?".   We should have walked out at that point but we foolishly didn't. We get seated at another part of the restaurant closer to the front door. He took our orders and we ordered the Friday's appetizer combo with buffalo chicken wings, mozzarella sticks, and potato skins. I ordered the same thing I have ordered at a Fridays for the last 28 years and that is the chicken fingers with french fries and extra honey mustard. Bobby ordered a cheeseburger. I ordered a strawberry lemonade for a drink and Bobby ordered a Diet Coke. Both drinks came with free refills.   At any other Friday's restaurant in which I have eaten, the chicken fingers come out pretty much the size of chicken cutlets. That's my over-exaggerated way of saying you get an awful lot of food.  I take one bite of my chicken fingers and automatically my gag reflex kicks in.  I wanted to vomit.  The chicken was freezer burned and yet slightly undercooked at the same time.  The breaded coating outside of the chicken had absolutely no seasoning and was also fried in an undercooked way. Absolutely nothing like the way the chicken fingers have been served to me in the last 28 years in numerous other Fridays restaurants. Bobby had a funny look on his face so I decided to take a bite of his Burger. The meat had no flavor because it was freezer burnt meat and because it had no seasoning. Now, between the time we finished our appetizer and we got our main course, the waiter who took our orders asked us if we wanted drink refills. Bobby said he wanted another Diet Coke. You would think that we would get his drink pretty instantaneously considering the restaurant is completely devoid of customers. But that did not happen. It was almost a blessing that the food was completely inedible comma since he had no beverage to wash his food down with.  The refill on his diet coke never arrived.  I had to track somebody down to get us the check because nobody was coming to check on us. When we finally get the bill, it was $49 and some change. So basically appetizer to drinks chicken fingers in a burger was $50. The girl who brought us our check ask if you wanted to food wrapped up since we barely touched them. I told her no we did not because they were completely inedible. She then proceeded to ask if I wanted to speak to the manager. Gee, Captain Obvious, what do you think the answer to that question is? The manager comes over and asks us the problem and we tell her everything that transpired. We told her we had no problem paying for the drinks and appetizers since we did consume them but we had an issue paying for the burgers and chicken fingers considering we couldn't eat them at all. We couldn't even bring it home because there would have been no point, it would have gone straight to the garbage.  Any other restaurant I have ever been in, the manager would have just comped us the whole bill, even though we had offered to pay for the appetizer. To me, that's just good customer service. Needless to say, we will never go back to this place again.  After I post this review on Yelp and Facebook, I will contact their corporate headquarters to see if this place should be shut down all together. My reasoning for this, is that after I thought about what that smell was when we were sitting by the bar, I came to the realization that smell comes from places which have a cockroach infestation. Also, Bobby had to flick something off the table when we first sat down. I told him after the fact that it was the shell that cockroaches come out of when they go from baby cockroaches to adult cockroaches. You have all been warned. Buyer beware!

Ordered food there a couple years ago found hair wrapped up in broccoli swore I'd never go back. Then forgot and totally thought it had happened at houlihans instead. Well, last week my family and I order the sampler and low and behold a long friggin blonde hair right across the plate!!! Disgusting!!! Then I looked at my husband and asked "it WAS here wasn't it?" And it was. Geez people wear hairnets damn it!!! Sorry Houlihans I was mistaken.

Service was slow. Water. We're 45 minutes on, took forever to receive our second round of endless apps (which has small portions) and our water hasn't even been refilled. Manager on duty is super cool tho.

Mediocre food, long wait for food, and the waiters are non-existent after order is taken...  Believe it or not, the same holds for numerous TGI's I've had the misfortune of eating in. Must be poor management to allow the lack of service.  I stopped going as I don't appreciate the long waits for our food, and the worst part is, food's not even hot when it arrives.

I have a Gluten issue right now and I was so happy the wait staff and manager were so VERY accommodating to all my questions and concerns.  My steak and salad were beautifully prepared.  And the rest of the table loved the endless apps for $10.  Huge bargain!

Went to this establishment for dinner on 6/19/17 at 9:30pm. My family of five walked into an empty restaurant where several tables were available for seating.  We waited for 7 minutes before we were greeted by a hostess who inquired about our party quantity,  and then left to never return.  Needless to say we waited and never were seated. Terrible customer service.

White broccoli cheddar soup was cold. Chicken quesadilla was okay, but didn't come with enough guacamole. Sweet potato fries were cold, and we returned them. New fries were freezer burned.  Burger was extremely greasy. Waitress was lovely. Service is getting better, but food is getting worse!

The worst TGIF I have ever been too. I walked in to play pool sat at a bar table for 30 minutes and was not even offered a drink or any food. I went up to the host and he informed me that the bartender is supposed to help me. I walked into the bar at 6:30 which was happy hour. After waiting for a half an hour for the bartender to help me, I was told to go to the bartenders to order. I ordered a glass of Pino which was $4.50 and two coronas which were three dollars and I was charged in the end $17.50 because the bartender Carmen said it was after happy hour. I felt the negative vibe from the bartender plus I felt I was overcharged in which I arrived at happy hour. The bartender never asked me if I wanted anything to eat and just asked me for my credit card to pay. Overall the worst Fridays I ever been too and will never go back

Where to start? Three of us decided to visit this restaurant, in hopes of abusing the $10 endless appetizers. The hours of operation are from 11am - 12 midnight; we arrived at 9pm. The waiter informs us that if one person orders the endless appetizers, all the people at the table have to order it. We agreed. The waiter then explains that the first round will be half orders, and once the first order has been delivered to the table we can ask for subsequent orders. According to the waiter, we can order anything on the list. I decided to order meatballs, another person decided to order quesadillas, and the other person decided to order potato skins. The waiter, trying to be friendly, said he'll take her second orders now. So, for our second round,  we ordered potstickers, chicken wings, and nachos. After about 30 minutes our first order finally arrived. We all got potato skins. We started working on our potato skins, when the next round appeared. The second round came out correctly. As we prepared to order our third round, the waiter informed us that he will have to cut us off. The reason, was that the kitchen was closing early. As a result, we were not able to take full advantage of the Endless appetizers. Additionally, our drinks orders took forever.

Came here for lunch  and was seated at the bar. Started off good, manager/bartender took my order and returned quickly with drinks. He then disappeared and apparently was so engrossed with a conversation with his colleagues that he left my table alone 15-20 minutes. When I asked to see my waiter, I saw him pop up out of his seat and run into the kitchen to reheat it. Nice. To top this off, I had asked for a Caesar salad. He brought out a small cup of Caesar dressing. Claims he thought I wanted that. Who asks for a cup of Caesar dressing?  This is the first time in quite some time I had terrible service. The ultimate faux pas was I had to ask to refill my drink. With no customers there at the time, no excuse for lack of top notch service. If this was in fact the manager, I understand why the service is poor. You will never have great service with ineffective management.

Wow this place was near empty tonight (Wednesday) and about 95% of the tables were not bussed-still had dirty plates, glasses and garbage all around you as you sat down. We couldn't imagine the food so we left. This is unacceptable and especially on a slower night!

Me and my boyfriend absolutely love this Fridays! No matter when we go we always receive awesome service. Our favorite server is Alexandra. We always have a great experience here , food is good and drinks are good that's all you can ask for from a Fridays
No more NFL Red zone?Done with Tgif's for me. One of the major incentives to go there and they took it away? Last time....
This is literally the worst Friday's ever. Literally 5 servers have looked at us and ignored us when asking for a check. And our server is MIA.

Why does anyone even go to this TGI Fridays anymore?  The review are terrible and nothing gets fixed.  After I wrote my review a year ago, the manager contacted me and offered a free lunch.  I didn't take him up on the offer but did give him some advice.  He said this TGI Fridays was an underperforming restaurant and he was brought into to try to fix the issues.  The problems have obviously not been resolved.  I drive by the place during lunch time regularly and never see more than a few cars in the parking lot.  It seems the people in the area know how bad it is.  My advise:  stay away until management and the corporate office decide to do something with this restaurant.
Update: the server has instructed me on how the effects of marijuana are far healthier for me than medications... I wasn't expecting dinner AND a show.

I usually go to the TGI Fridays on Route 3, but for convenience sake we came to this one. Honestly, we didn't even get to the part of ordering drinks because we never got the chance to. My family and I got seated, and the waiter didn't even bother to show his face until I started looking around for our waiter. He said that he had a table that asked for all separate checks and asked us to hold on. We waited for 20 minutes and he was still figuring out the checks. He could have at least taken our drink orders or something. My family got fed up with this kind of service and we decided to leave. My dad, who usually doesn't get angry, told the waiter he wasn't happy with this kind of service. We got absolutely no apologies and just excuses. He basically claimed that it wasn't his fault because he explained his situation to us. He got angry at us.  To make things worse, the manager was right next to him and didn't say a word. We will be never coming here again. And seeing all these 1 star ratings show that this place isn't doing so hot. Please drive the extra 10 minutes to go to the TGI Fridays on route 3.
Had the best server I have ever had, her name was Amanda. She always got everything on time and made great conversation with the table. Made our dinning experience amazing!
